title: Dani Dyer’s sweet response to Jack Fincham relationship question
text:
From Cosmopolitan

It’s been seven months since Dani Dyer and Jack Fincham called it quits and joined the exceptionally long list of Love Island couples who have split after leaving the villa.

At the time, trolls accused the pair of faking their nine-month relationship despite millions of us watching them fall for each other right in front of our eyes at 9pm Monday-Friday for two entire months.

Now Dani, who recently opened up about having therapy to cope with the sudden fame she experienced after winning the show alongside Jack, has insisted their romance was totally genuine.

Photo credit: Rex More

“I know what I am and I would never fake a relationship,” the 23-year-old shared.

Praising the former pen salesman, Dani added to the Mirror: “It was beautiful. We had a great summer. It just didn’t work out. People are in love and sometimes it doesn’t work out.

“That’s what happened with us. The British public aren’t stupid. They watched us for eight weeks. They’d suss us out. I wear my heart on my sleeve and I’m such a ­romantic person.

“I fall in love hard. I’d struggle to go on a show and fake a relationship. It’s harder to lie than tell the truth.”

Photo credit: ITV More

Jack also previously opened up about the pair’s split, sharing his thoughts on why things ultimately didn’t work out.

"If we had lived in Love Island forever, we’d have been fine. We rushed it straight away, we moved in together,” he said during his hunt for love on E4’s Celebs Go Dating.

“I did want to, but I wish we had waited. I let her rush me a little bit. We had a genuine connection in there and I think anyone can see that."
